heaviest_rainfall.status: The largest amount of rain ever recorded is on 04 January 2025 when 36.8mm fell at a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour over the 37.2 hour event.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The rain rate reached 22.1mm per hour during the storm today (ranking 2nd from our records) and resulted in 8.45mm of total rain in 2.3 hours.  A torrential downpour occurred on 02 September 2025 when the rain reached a maximum intensity of 27.0mm per hour.  This happened during a 15.0 hour storm when 21.19mm of rain fell.

longest_rain.status: On 04 January 2025, the rain lasted for 37.2 hours, which is the longest time recorded by our database.  36.8mm accumulated and it fell at 4.6mm per hour at times.

most_lightning.status: Since 11 April 2025, the day with the most lightning strikes is 07 September 2025 when 23 were seen.

nearest_lightning.status: Today marked the nearest lightning strike since monitoring began on 11 April 2025.

storm.status: A storm is passing through the area.  This marks the first storm since 12 September 2025.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The ongoing rainy stretch, 5 days and counting started on 09 September 2025 and ranks 11th in length since records started in 23 September 2024.  The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is not a cold snap right now.  There have been 6 this year, compared to a usual average of 3.7.

extreme.status: The record temperature difference stands at 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C), set on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: There is no heatwaves at the moment.  This year has experienced 6 heatwavess, with an average of 1.9 per year.

tropical.status: The last observed tropical night was 18 July 2025, making a total of only 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (198°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The record wind gust remains at 93.7 mph from 13 October 2012.

run.status: The record wind run remains at 1754 miles from 21 October 2012.

speed.status: 93.7 mph is the largest wind speed recorded on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, more moisture-laden rainfall (up 1.1 mm).

The past week and month had observable variation in cloud levels (up 606 m), feels like temperature (up 3.7°C), outside temperature (up 2.4°C), and inside temperature (up 2.8°C) when compared to today.

cloud levels.description:
Today’s average cloud levels is 123.7m lower than yesterday, 161.4m lower than the past week, 605.7m lower than the past month.

The cloud levels for yesterday ranged from 939m to 3180m and averaged 1662.6m, while the past week and month indicated warmer conditions.
cloud levels.summary: The clouds will be high, plenty of sunshine is expected.

summary.summary: Inside; temperature should feel pleasantly mild. Outside; mild and pleasant. Also, neither too dry nor too humid and calm and still conditions are expected. Light to moderate rain is forecast, the clouds will be high, plenty of sunshine is expected, and bright intervals likely. Weather could become unsettled.
